text: - Once we've binded to an address, we must listen for connections - int listen(int sockfd, int backlog); - Sockfd is the socket, backlog is the maximum length that the queue of pending connections can be - When a connection comes in, we can accept it: - int accept(int sockfd, struct sockaddr *_Nullable restrict addr, socklen_t *_Nullable restrict addrlen - Addr is where the incoming connectionâ€™s address will be put
